name: Google Cloud Run
purpose: Serverless platform for deploying and scaling containerized applications with automatic HTTPS and instant deployment
description: Google Cloud's fully managed serverless platform that runs stateless containers via HTTP. Integrated with Google AI Studio's Build tab for one-click deployment of AI-generated web applications. Features automatic scaling from zero to N, pay-per-use pricing, custom domains, HTTPS by default, and seamless integration with Google Cloud ecosystem.
platform_compatibility: Any language/framework that runs in containers
integration_capabilities: Google AI Studio Build tab (one-click deploy)

actual_remote_helpers_usage.primary_use: No-Code Web App Deployment via Google AI Studio
use_cases: deploy AI-generated web apps from Google AI Studio
create instant public URLs for prototypes
workflows: WRF-024: Build and Deploy Web App

strengths: One-click deployment from Google AI Studio Build tab
True serverless - scales to zero when not in use
Pay only for actual request time (not idle time)
limitations: Cold start latency for infrequently accessed services
Pricing can increase with high traffic

pricing_model.note: Only billed for actual request duration, not idle time

google_ai_studio_integration.workflow: Generate app → Preview → Deploy button → Instant public URL

alternatives.name: Vercel
alternatives.comparison: Better for Next.js/React, but Cloud Run supports any language

alternatives.name: AWS Lambda
alternatives.comparison: Similar serverless, but Cloud Run handles containers vs functions

alternatives.name: Netlify
alternatives.comparison: Frontend-focused, Cloud Run handles full-stack apps

alternatives.name: Render
alternatives.comparison: Similar PaaS, but Cloud Run has better Google ecosystem integration

video_source.video_title: Google AI Studio Full Walkthrough and Tutorial
video_source.creator: AI for Grownups
